basic.floral_language:
Hatiora gaertneri
Floriography: lucky, fine, tenacious.
Hatiora gaertneri is an epiphytic succulent plant. It grows a number of drooping branches. Each branch comprises of several connection branch sections. This plant usually grows on other trees or damp valleys.
Hatiora gaertneri prefers mild sunlight and is partial shade tolerant. It would go into a short dormancy in hot summer and should be removed to a cool and shaded place. Rose red or red flowers bloom in October to next February.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, rose red or red flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil
maintenance.sunlight: Half shade plant, like moderate light, properly shade during half dormancy in summer
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer and winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn, except flowering time and dormancy in summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers and stem after flowering, except the 2-3 segments at the bottom of stem
